abstract.text: A
object allows you to manage the appearance and content of text fields.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: objects support interactive forms in a PDF document. This object is comparable to an editable
in Cocoa or an edit text view in Carbon.

abstract.text: Display and manipulate PDF documents in your apps.
An annotation in a PDF document.
A
object provides user interactivity on a page of a PDF document. There are three types of buttons available: push button, radio button, and checkbox.
A
object provides user interactivity on a page of a PDF document, in the form of pop-up menus and lists.
A
object displays text on a page.
A
object displays a single line on a page.
A
object appears as highlighting, underlining, or a strikethrough style applied to the text of a document.
A
object provides user interactivity on a PDF page in the form of a pop-up menu.
A rectangle annotation on a page.
A
object allows you to display a word or phrase, such as “Confidential,” in a PDF page.
The type of annotation, such as circle, text, or ink.
A
object displays as an icon (such as a “sticky note”) attached to a specified point in the PDF document.
A
object allows you to manage the appearance and content of text fields.
Returns the text alignment setting for the annotation.
Returns the background color of the annotation text field.
Returns the internal name for the annotation text field.
Returns the font used for the annotation’s text field.
Returns the font color used for the annotation’s text field.
Returns the maximum number of characters allowed in the annotation string.
Returns the rotation angle of the annotation text field in degrees.
Sets the text alignment for the annotation.
Sets the background color of the annotation text field.
Sets the internal field name for the annotation text field.
Sets the font used in the text field of the annotation.
Sets the font color used for the annotation’s text field.
Sets the maximum number of characters allowed in the annotation string.
Sets the rotation angle of the annotation text field in degrees.
Sets the string for the annotation.
Returns the string assigned to the annotation.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

Managing Background Color, Alignment, and Rotation
